qas.question: What desires were expected to be suppressed during the fasting period?
All rich food and drink were consumed before what named event?
The giant celebration that involved the whole community is thought to be the origin of what festivity?
How long is the Lenten period of the Liturgical calendar?
What type of rich foods did people refrain from eating during Lent?

context: Traditionally the feast also applied to <a0_0>sexual<a0_0/> desires, which were supposed to be suppressed during the following fasting. Before <a1_0>Lent<a1_0/> began, all rich food and drink were consumed in what became a giant celebration that involved the whole community, and is thought to be the origin of <a2_0>Carnival<a2_0/>. The Lenten period of the Liturgical calendar, the <a3_0>six weeks<a3_0/> directly before Easter, was originally marked by fasting and other pious or penitential practices. During Lent, no parties or celebrations were held, and people refrained from eating rich foods, such as <a4_0>meat, dairy, fat and sugar<a4_0/>.
